entry.title: UniFi Switch 6.4.18
entry.summary:
Overview * This release has been promoted to Official/Stable for the following model(s):
USW-Flex
It's still an Release Candidate for all other models. Improvements
[USW] Add PoE fault event in syslog. [USW] Improve device inform scheduling. [USW] Improve inform URL resolving for IPv6 domain name. [USP-RPS] improve the RPS power activate detection. [USW-Flex] Enable PoE-injector mode by default. [USW-Pro-Aggregation] Enlarge message queue and improve the critical section handling.
Bugfixes
[USW] Fix inform URL override with default URL in a rare case. [USW-PoE] Fix can't unblock a port after disable port-security. [USW-PoE] Fix incorrect port speed if LAG member port not used. [USW-PoE] Fix missing TX/RX error counter reading. [USW-Pro] Fix incorrect RPS Activated screen when no RPS c…

entry.title: UniFi Access Point 6.2.49
entry.summary:
Improvements
[UAP] Make band steering less strict. [UAP] Improve overall stability.
Bugfixes
[UAP] Fix APs cycling between 'Getting Ready' and 'Online' continuously when Lock to AP is in-use and any AP goes down (e.g. for a firmware update). This led to all clients getting disconnected randomly. [UAP] Fix incorrect manual firmware update URL leading to the AP going offline in the Network Application. [UAP] Fix IPv6 inform address resolution not working (affects L3 adoptions). [UAP-Gen6] Fix AP getting stuck when rebooting after a firmware update. [UAP-Gen6] Fix Error-A12 state on APs after a firmware update, leading to various side-effects (AP getting stuck randomly, firmware updates failing, etc.).
Additional information
U6-Pro/Mesh needs to be upgraded to 5.67.0 first before upgrading to 5.68.0+. Instead of using the manual links, you can also configure the Device Firmware Release Channel in the Network Application (enable Early Access Release Channels) Please refer to this article to find more details on how to identify your Access Point generation. Your device built-in display may turn black or unresponsive for ~10 minutes after firmware upgrades to upgrade LCM firmware. All URLs use HTTPS. This assumes your device(s) are running 3.7.56 or later and that the device's date is properly set. Please change URLs to HTTP for device(s) running earlier firmware or if the date is incorrect (e.g. if device can't reach a NTP server).
Any and all feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. When reporting an issue, please ensure that you include the following information:
Network Application version. Firmware version (previous and current). Device model(s).

entry.title: UniFi LTE 6.2.48
entry.summary:
Improvements
[LTE] Update LTE module. [LTE] Update LCM messages. [LTE] Improve LTE module firmware update process.
Additional information
Instead of using the manual links, you can also subscribe to your desired firmware channel, as described here. All URLs use HTTPS. This assumes your device(s) are running 3.7.56 or later and that the device's date is properly set. Please change URLs to HTTP for device(s) running earlier firmware or if the date is incorrect (e.g. if device can't reach a NTP server).
Any and all feedback is welcome, including lettings us know about successful device upgrades. When reporting an issue, please ensure that you include the following information:
Network Application version. Firmware version (previous and current). Device model(s).
